div.l: Thys Miller hath so wisly bibbed ale
That as an hors · he snortith in his sleepe
Ne of his taile behynd toke he no kepe
His wif bare hym · a burdoun̄ ful strong
Men myghten here hem rowte · a furlong
The wenche Rowtith eeke · ꝑpar compaignie
Alayn the clerke · that herd this melodie
He poked Iohn and saide slepistow
Herd thow eu͗er · slike a sang er now
Lo swilk a complyne · is among hem alle
A wield fuyre · mote on theyr bodies falle
Wha herd eu͗er slike · a ferly thyng
Ye they shal have · the floure of il endyng
This lang nyght · there tydes me na Rest
But yit na fors · al shalbe for the best
For Iohn in faith · als eu͗er mote I thryve
If that I may · yone wenche wil I swyve
Som easement the lawe hath shapen vs
For Iohn ther is a lawe · that saith thus
That if a man · in oo poynt be agreved
That in another · he shalbe Releved
Oure corn is stole · sothly this is no nay
And we han hadde · an il fitte to day
And syn I shal have · non amendement
Agayn my losse · I wil have som easement
Bi goddis soule · it shal nonother be
This Iohn aunswerd · Alayn avise the
The Miller is a ꝑparlous man he saide
And if that he · out of his sleepe abraide
